TopicTitle: How do I get more framerate with Scaterrer mod?

Articles.Content: So I downloaded a graphical modification called Astronomer's visual pack repackaged, and I noticed heavy lag on Kerbin, and I am completely sure that the problem is scaterrer. So how do i get more Framerate, without deleting the mod? I have already disabled all ocean shaders and terrain shaders.

Depending on the version of KSP you are running, it might be throwing exceptions constantly and slowing down everything. check the log file in \KSP_x64_Data\output_log.txt while the game is running. 

I had to delete scatterer, even though I loved it, because of the constant exceptions being thrown.

On 17/08/2017 at 1:41 PM, Broken_Satellite said:

So I downloaded a graphical modification called Astronomer's visual pack repackaged, and I noticed heavy lag on Kerbin, and I am completely sure that the problem is scaterrer. So how do i get more Framerate, without deleting the mod? I have already disabled all ocean shaders and terrain shaders.

Yeah, good luck with that. I also love Scatterer, but seriously, it is pretty computation-intensive on a conceptual level. I don't think there's any setting you can tune to make it faster.

It breaks my heart not to use that mod, but my potato computer begs me to let it die when I try it
yea, the only part is when i am in Kerbin, tho it lags when using stuff like Warp Drives, so now i'm forced to not use the mod because it lags the game with enchancements.

Lag on Kerbin could result from Scatterer-EVE integration (which may be disabled at the cost of some visuals becoming subpar), or really any of the more intensive scatterer settings. If the lag occurs while penetrating the cloud layers, it is likely due to the volumetric clouds which only occur at that specific phase.

Use the Alt+F11 menu to disable features in the main menu and adjust settings in the game to tweak values down. Water refraction is a big hog, but blackrack only added it recently so maybe it can still be optimized further
